sentences: Patricia Barber (born November 8, 1955) is an American jazz and blues singer, pianist, songwriter, and bandleader.
She concentrated on piano at the University of Iowa in the early 1970s.
After graduating, she performed at bars and clubs in Chicago.
She won a Guggenheim Fellowship in music composition in March 2003, an unusual accomplishment for someone working in the field of popular songwriting.
In November 2008, she was interviewed by Gregg Shapiro of Gay & Lesbian Times magazine.
